events.name: Day 2 - IRAS Hackathon 2016
events.description: This is day 2 of a 3-day event hosted by UP Singapore and is being announced on behalf of our community member. Title: IRAS Hackathon 2016 Speakers: Various SMEs, Tech Mentors, Microsoft MVPs, see more at: http://www.upsingapore.com/events/iras-hackathon/#experts Abstract: UP Singapore is proud to announce the first ever IRAS Hackathon! In line with a nation-wide strategy to provide public services with a citizen-centric approach, IRAS would like to explore how to provide best-in-class tax experiences to Singapore’s taxpayers, using intuitive digital services. Learn more about the theme and opportunity areas of this hackathon at our Theme page here: http://bit.ly/iras-theme At the IRAS hackathon, you will have the chance to create and pitch your idea to a senior and distinguished panel of judges. Also, the winning team in both the Startup and Open Categories, will take home a cash prize of $3,000! Sign up now! http://bit.ly/2aXJMHg Learn more about the IRAS Hackathon 2016 here: http://bit.ly/iras-hackathon-2016 We are promoting this event because it aligns with our group interests. For deeper engagement with Apache Apex - follow ApacheApex, presentations, recordings, download (community, sandbox), Apache Apex releases, docs
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium, One Marina Boulevard, Level 21, 018989, Singapore
events.group_name: Apache Apex Next Gen Native Hadoop Big Data, Singapore

events.name: Game Programming in Kodu Sep 3 at Toa Payoh East CC (Free)
events.description:
Game Programming in Kodu
 
Date:      Saturday Sep 3
Time:     11:15am - 12:15pm (Session 1), 12:30pm 1:30pm (Session 2)
Fees:     Free 
Age:      7-12 years
 
Note: Each session is an hour. The 2 sessions are exactly the same. Please only attend one. 
  
Workshop Description  
Kodu lets kids create games on the PC and Xbox via a simple visual programming language. Kodu can be used to teach creativity, problem solving, storytelling, as well as programming. Anyone can use Kodu to make a game, young children as well as adults with no design or programming skills.
In this introductory workshop, kids will learn how to create their own Kodu world and make a simple game.

 
 

Please note:
We will be filming and taking photographs of the children during the workshop. By registering your children's attendance at this workshop, Parents/Guardians grant Saturday Kids a perpetual licence to use Students’ work, photographs or videos of the Student, and other materials for purposes such as publicising or promoting our workshops/events and the students’ accomplishments.
events.location: Toa Payoh East Community Club, 160 Lorong 6 Toa Payoh, Singapore  319380

events.name: Design Disruptors Film Screening
events.description:
Register for free here: bit.ly/2adBcl1

Join General Assembly and SCAPE for a screening of the InVision-produced documentary Design Disruptors.

DESIGN DISRUPTORS reveals a never-before-seen perspective on the design approaches of 15+ industry-shaking companies, and how they’re using the power of design to disrupt billion dollar industries.

Grab a drink and some movie treats. Seating is limited—reserve your seat today!
events.location: Scape Gallery @ Level 5, 2 Orchard Link, Singapore 237978

events.name: LEARN TO PROGRAM WITH PYTHON - FREE INTRODUCTORY WORKSHOP
events.description: To confirm your slot, please register via: http://peatix.com/event/195825/ PYTHON FOR BEGINNERS Python is a highly recommended programming language for beginners. The general purpose dynamic language which can be used to perform any programming tasks from GUI to web, is a popular choice of programming language for start-ups. Famous platforms such as Youtube, Dropbox and SurveyMonkey are also powered by Python. This free introductory workshop will teach you the basics of Python and you will gain an understanding of its practical applications in the real world. The workshop will also cover the technical aspects of installation and how to set up a Python environment to begin your development. You will also get basic hands-on practice with Python syntax."
events.location: IDA Labs Level 3 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #03-04, 188969, Singapore
